title: Amid Tariff Chaos, U.S. Allies Try to Redraw the Trade Map
summary: Facing growing chaos, the European Union and numerous other countries are seeking to forge a global trading nexus that is less vulnerable to American tariffs.

title: To Sidestep Trump Tariffs, Asian Nations Seek New Trade Partners
summary: Most nations are still negotiating in hopes of avoiding punitive import taxes. At the same time, they’re looking for trading partners as a way around the United States.

title: Tariffs on Brazil Could Leave Coffee Drinkers With a Headache
summary: Trump’s pledge to place a 50 percent tariff on all imports from the South American nation will drive up the prices of coffee — and orange juice.

title: Trump Threatens Fresh Tariffs on E.U., Mexico and Canada: What to Know
summary: Since re-entering office, President Trump has announced a barrage of tariffs to try to rewire the global economy.

title: Trump Is Gutting Weather Science and Reducing Disaster Response
summary: As a warming planet delivers more extreme weather, experts warn that the Trump administration is dismantling the government’s disaster capabilities.

title: From Science to Diversity, Trump Hits the Reverse Button on Decades of Change
summary: President Trump has moved aggressively to reopen long-settled issues and to dismantle long-established institutions as he tries to return to what he considers better times.

title: What to Know About the Secret Service, a Year After It Failed to Protect Trump
summary: The agency withstood criticism and a reckoning after a lone assassin grazed Donald J. Trump on the campaign trail. Today, recruiting is up.

title: The Quiet Unraveling of the Man Who Almost Killed Trump
summary: Thomas Crooks was a nerdy engineering student on the dean’s list. He stockpiled explosive materials for months before his attack on Donald Trump, as his mental health eroded.

title: Texans Offer a Hand and Open Their Hearts as Flood Death Toll Grows
summary: Mourners paid tribute at funerals and memorial services on Saturday as the number of fatalities rose to nearly 130.

title: FEMA Approved Removal of Many Camp Mystic Buildings From Flood Zones
summary: Camp Mystic owners successfully appealed to the Federal Emergency Management Agency to redesignate some buildings that had been considered part of a flood-hazard zone.

title: Flood Watch Issued for Kerr County With Chance for Heavy Rain
summary: The threat of heavy rain is “slight” for this weekend, but with the ground fully saturated in Kerr County, even small amounts of rainfall could cause flooding.

title: So Your Doctor Is a DO. Does That Matter?
summary: The number of osteopathic doctors has increased dramatically. People still don’t know what they are.

title: What Is a D.O.?
summary: We explain how to pick a doctor.

title: He Claims He’s the ‘Sports Betting King.’ What Are the Odds?
summary: Mazi VS has become a major influencer by flaunting his expensive lifestyle and his big-winning wagers. Other gamblers say he can’t be what he seems.

title: Why the U.S. Is Way Behind China in Making Drones for War
summary: A four-day test in the Alaska wilderness shows how far the U.S. military and American drone companies lag behind China in the technology.

title: MAGA Is Tearing Itself Apart Over Jeffrey Epstein
summary: What happens when Trump becomes the “deep state”?

title: Trolling Democracy
summary: The rise of a toxic online politics.

title: Climate Law Could Shape the Race for New York City’s Next Mayor
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee, has vowed to strictly enforce the measure, Local Law 97, which calls for potentially expensive upgrades to buildings to curb greenhouse emissions.

title: Bob Geldof Reflects on Live Aid, 40 Years Later
summary: The rock star-turned-activist reflects on the 1985 benefit concert and why it could not happen now.

title: Modi Wants More Indians to Speak Hindi. Some States Are Shouting ‘No.’
summary: States worry that the imposition of Hindi, the main language of northern India, would wipe out their cultural heritage.

title: New York City Set to Expand Minimum Pay Law for Delivery Workers
summary: The City Council is expected to pass a package of bills to include nearly 20,000 grocery delivery workers in legislation that improved working conditions for food delivery workers.
